name: Null Ransomware Encrypted File
summary: A file with a .null extension is a file that has been encrypted by the Null virus, which is a variant of Stop and Djvu ransomware that became prevalent in August 2017. It is encrypted with an AES-256 algorithm, so it is not possible to open the file by simply changing the .null file extension.

open.note: Open with an associated app listed below.
